info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 4:32PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Flathead County through 515 PM MDT... At 432 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kalispell, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half-inch size hail. Brief heavy rain can also be expected. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kalispell, Evergreen, Bigfork and Creston. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 117 and 125. Highway 93 between mile markers 104 and 117. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
